Key Match Events: Germany scored two goals in the first half
Scotland's Ryan Porteous was sent off for a foul on Germany's Ilkay Gundogan
Kai Havertz converted the resulting penalty kick
Jamal Musiala scored Germany's third goal
Scotland conceded five goals for the first time in 12 years
Post-Match Reflections: Germany captain İlkay Gündoğan praised his team's performance
Scotland manager Steve Clarke expressed disappointment with his team's performance
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was the Euro 2024 curtainraiser
Host Germany gave Euro 2024 liftoff by outclassing 10-man Scotland 5-1
Others: Scotland didn't have a shot on goal all match until late in the game when the ball was bundled into the back of the net for an own goal
Substitutes Niclas Füllkrug and Emre Can piled on to Scotland's misery after the break
Scotland's Tartan Army of supporters started the match in fine voice but were swiftly quietened
Steve Clarke's side will have to do better against Hungary and Switzerland if it is to get out of Group A and reach the knockout stage for the first time
